answers.text:
Hi Lillian, 
Thank you for your question!  I have found a few resources on the Knowledge Network that might be helpful to you! 
Read about the City of Olathe and their Leadership Program as they teamed up with the University of Kansas.  Check out their report, “Creating a Supervisory Leadership Training Program."
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304296/Creating_a_Supervisory_Leadership_Training_Program 
Dr. Frank Benest posted a great article about leadership, mid-level staffing, and how to advance in Career Compass No. 5: "Developing Leadership Skills When You Have No Formal Authority."
http://icma.org/en/Article/4642/Career_Compass_No_5_Developing_Leadership_Skills_When_You_Have_No_Formal_Authority 
El Paso, Texas is a great example of continual development training as they made sure that despite hard economic times, tuition assistance, leadership and management training was still offered to those in their City.  Read more here: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304292/Continuous_Leadership_Development
Don’t forget to check out ICMA University: leadership training to help advance skills and professional management for your local government with workshops, career development programs, self-development programs, and more!
http://icma.org/en/university/home
I hope these answers helped you!  Best of luck! 
Hilary Badger
Knowledge Network, Intern
ICMA

answers.author: Cheryl Hilvert
answers.text:
Hi Lillian,
There is also a great program for identifying and developing leadership competencies among staff by a company by the name of Lominger/Korn Ferry.  This model has been utilized by the City of Dublin, Ohio, and others, very successfully and points to both the types of competencies that can propel an employee forward in their career as well as several that are "career stoppers."  If used in the development/refinement of position descriptions or training, I think you would find this approach very interesting and useful.
If you would like to learn more, I can put you in touch with one of the service providers in the Center for Management Strategies who is certified in the Lominger program.  They would be happy to share some additional information with you.
Thanks for your inquiry to the Knowledge Network and please let us know if we can assist you further.  You may also want to look at the webpage for the Center for Management Strategies at http://icma.org/en/results/management_strategies/home  and check out our High Performance Organization leading practice area or our CMS Blog at http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blog/50/Center_for_Management_Strategies 
or our CMS Group at http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/groups/kn/group/1302
These are good places to outreach to people with questions regarding organizational development too!
Good luck Lillian!  Please let me know if I can assist you in any way.

author: Lillian Hua
text: We currently provide leadership trainings but we need to match the competencies (for example: delegation, coaching, conflict resolution, etc) with the leadership position level (for example: future supervisors, leads, supervisors, mid-level management, senior executives, etc). Has anybody done this work in your city? (i.e. what trainings each level should take to be successful?) If you would be willing to share with us, we would be very appreciative!
title: Looking to create leadership competencies for various supervisory position
